meanings.definition: The theory or practice of representing things in a realistic way.
meanings.sent1: In art class, we learned about representationalism by drawing objects as they appear in real life.
meanings.sent2: Artists who follow representationalism aim to depict subjects accurately and true to life.
meanings.sent3: The representationalism of the painting made it look like a photograph!
meanings.sent4: Her representationalism in capturing the essence of nature was truly remarkable.
meanings.sent5: The simplicity of representationalism helps viewers easily recognize the subject.

meanings.definition: The belief that knowledge is based on the perception of objects external to the mind.
meanings.sent1: His strong representationalism led him to trust only what he could see and touch.
meanings.sent2: Representationalism suggests that our understanding of the world comes from observing the physical world around us.
meanings.sent3: The extreme representationalism of his views made him skeptical of anything beyond his immediate senses.
meanings.sent4: In a world of representationalism, imagination is often undervalued.
meanings.sent5: The concept of representationalism can limit our ability to appreciate abstract ideas.
